intro: Schoenus smitinandii, commonly known as the Smitinandii grass, is a rare and endemic plant species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal or inland areas with a temperate climate. Its small, spike-like inflorescences produce wind-pollinated flowers, and it plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
